## Observation notes  
First documented by Fletcher and Gibson, 1908, with extensive historical record in the Pacific Maritime (see Best list for historical record to 2000). Tommasi et al. 2004: <span class="hl-place-name"><span class="hl-place-name">Greater <span class="hl-place-name">Vancouver</span></span> Area</span>. Ratti et al. 2008:  <span class="hl-place-name">Fraser Valley</span>. Biodiversity Galiano Life List: (G.G.E. Scudder), 1973, Galiano. Guzman et al., 2023: (Elle), 2005; (Neame), 2007; (Gielens), 2009, 2010; (Wray), 2012; (Gillespie), 2014, 2015; (Kelly), 2017, <span class="hl-place-name"><span class="hl-place-name"><span class="hl-place-name">Vancouver</span> Is</span>land</span>. (Button), 2011, <span class="hl-place-name">Abbotsford</span>; (Gehrels), 2013; (Toshack), 2015; (Bobiwash), 2016; (Elle), 2016, <span class="hl-place-name">Lower Mainland</span>. NBSBC Bee Atlas Database: (Zand), 2021, <span class="hl-place-name"><span class="hl-place-name"><span class="hl-place-name">Vancouver</span> Is</span>land</span>; (Gadzik), (Young), (Nicholls), (Carmichael), 2022, <span class="hl-place-name"><span class="hl-place-name"><span class="hl-place-name">Vancouver</span> Is</span>land</span>; (Young), (Cruise), 2022, <span class="hl-place-name">Greater <span class="hl-place-name">Vancouver</span></span>, <span class="hl-place-name">Sunshine Coast</span>. iNaturalist: common throughout the Pacific Maritime, from 2000.
